Package org.frc5010.common.commands

Class AkitDriveCommands

java.lang.Object
org.frc5010.common.commands.AkitDriveCommands
public class AkitDriveCommands extends Object
Factory class for creating swerve drive related commands including manual drive control, characterization routines, and PID tuning commands for drive and steer motors.

  • Method Details

    • joystickDrive

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command joystickDrive(GenericSwerveDrivetrain swerveDrive, AkitSwerveDrive drive, DoubleSupplier xSupplier, DoubleSupplier ySupplier, DoubleSupplier omegaSupplier)
      Field relative drive command using two joysticks (controlling linear and angular velocities).
      Parameters:
      swerveDrive - the swerve drivetrain subsystem to control
      drive - the swerve drive implementation
      xSupplier - supplier for the forward/backward joystick input
      ySupplier - supplier for the left/right joystick input
      omegaSupplier - supplier for the rotation joystick input
      Returns:
      a command that continuously reads joystick inputs and drives the robot

    • joystickDriveAtAngle

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command joystickDriveAtAngle(GenericSwerveDrivetrain swerveDrive, AkitSwerveDrive drive, DoubleSupplier xSupplier, DoubleSupplier ySupplier, Supplier<edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d> rotationSupplier)
      Field relative drive command using joystick for linear control and PID for angular control. Possible use cases include snapping to an angle, aiming at a vision target, or controlling absolute rotation with a joystick.
      Parameters:
      swerveDrive - the swerve drivetrain subsystem to control
      drive - the swerve drive implementation
      xSupplier - supplier for the forward/backward joystick input
      ySupplier - supplier for the left/right joystick input
      rotationSupplier - supplier for the target rotation angle
      Returns:
      a command that drives the robot while maintaining a target orientation

    • feedforwardCharacterization

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command feedforwardCharacterization(GenericSwerveDrivetrain swerveDrive, AkitSwerveDrive drive, Consumer<edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Voltage> characterizer, Supplier<Double> velocitySupplier)
      Measures the velocity feedforward constants for the drive motors.

      This command should only be used in voltage control mode.

      Parameters:
      swerveDrive - the swerve drivetrain subsystem to characterize
      drive - the swerve drive implementation
      characterizer - consumer that accepts voltage values to apply to drive motors
      velocitySupplier - supplier that returns the current velocity for measurement
      Returns:
      a command that performs feedforward characterization and logs results

    • wheelRadiusCharacterization

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command wheelRadiusCharacterization(GenericSwerveDrivetrain swerveDrive, AkitSwerveDrive drive)
      Measures the robot's wheel radius by spinning in a circle.
      Parameters:
      swerveDrive - the swerve drivetrain subsystem to characterize
      drive - the swerve drive implementation
      Returns:
      a command that measures wheel radius and logs the results to SmartDashboard

    • drivePIDTuning

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command drivePIDTuning(GenericSwerveDrivetrain swerveDrive, AkitSwerveDrive drive)
      Measures the proportional gain (P value) of the drive motor PID controllers.

      This command applies a range of target velocity setpoints to the drive motors and measures the resulting velocity errors to calculate a more robust P value for closed-loop control.

      The P value is calculated using: kP = Applied Voltage / Average Velocity Error across multiple setpoints

      Parameters:
      swerveDrive - the swerve drivetrain subsystem to tune
      drive - the swerve drive implementation
      Returns:
      a command that measures velocity errors across multiple setpoints and logs suggested kP values

    • steerPIDTuning

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command steerPIDTuning(GenericSwerveDrivetrain swerveDrive, AkitSwerveDrive drive)
      Measures the proportional gain (P value) of the steer motor PID controllers.

      This command applies a range of target angle setpoints to the steer motors and measures the resulting angle errors to calculate a more robust P value for closed-loop control.

      The P value is calculated using: kP = Applied Voltage / Average Angle Error across multiple setpoints

      Parameters:
      swerveDrive - the swerve drivetrain subsystem to tune
      drive - the swerve drive implementation
      Returns:
      a command that measures angle errors across multiple setpoints and logs suggested kP values
